title: Historical Volatility of One Liberty Properties Inc

content.text: Historical volatility refers to the measure of the stock's price fluctuation over a specific period. It helps investors assess the level of risk associated with owning a particular stock. In the case of One Liberty Properties Inc, the historical volatility can be determined by analyzing the stock's price movements over a defined time frame.

High historical volatility can significantly impact investor behavior. It often leads to increased uncertainty, as stock prices experience larger swings. This can result in more cautious investment decisions, as investors may be hesitant to take on additional risk or may choose to sell their holdings to limit potential losses. On the other hand, low historical volatility can lead to complacency, with investors potentially becoming overconfident and overlooking potential risks.

Understanding historical volatility is crucial for effective risk management. Investors can use this metric to evaluate the potential downside risk associated with owning a particular stock. By incorporating historical volatility into their investment decision-making process, investors can align their risk tolerance with the stock's price volatility. This may involve adjusting portfolio allocations, employing hedging strategies, or implementing stop-loss orders to mitigate potential losses. Risk management strategies can help investors protect their capital and make more informed investment decisions.

news.headline: One Liberty Properties Announces 124th Consecutive Quarterly Dividend
news.summary: – Increased or Maintained Dividend for Over 30 Consecutive Years – – Increases Current Share Repurchase Authorization – GREAT NECK, N.Y., Dec. 05, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- One Liberty Properties, Inc. (NYSE: OLP) today announced that its Board of Directors declared a quarterly dividend on the Company’s common stock of $0.45 per share.
